thread.title: Chinese train carriages get 'Miffy' makeover to celebrate rabbit's 60th anniversary
thread.title_full: Chinese train carriages get 'Miffy' makeover to celebrate rabbit's 60th anniversary | Daily Mail Online

author: Katie Amey for MailOnline
title: Chinese train carriages get 'Miffy' makeover to celebrate rabbit's 60th anniversary
text:
71 shares 1
View
comments
Creatively decorated metro carriages have made headlines this week after colourful interior artworks were commissioned to celebrate the 60th anniversary of a famous rabbit from the Netherlands.
Four carriages of the city metro in Guangzhou, which is the capital of southern China's Guangdong Province, have become all the rage among netizens and commuters after they appeared decorated with pictures of the popular cartoon rabbit 'Miffy'.
Miffy, or Nijntje in Dutch, was 'born' to artist and writer Dick Bruna, who first published the illustrations of the female rabbit in 1955.
'Miffy,' the popular cartoon rabbit, has taken over four carriages in the metro in Guangzhou, China
This year, to celebrate the rabbit's 60th 'birthday', the Guangzhou metro had drawings of Miffy commissioned to be added to the carriages, showing her dancing around in different coloured pastures.
The carriages have unsurprisingly become a popular photo spot for commuters in Guangzhou, who are quickly making the rest of the country envious with their unique decor.
 Next Adorable footage captures baby wallaby Monti settling into... The jaw-dropping photos from adventurer's 60,000 mile tour... EasyJet apologises after in-flight magazine highlights... Book two one-way flights, change your location settings and... 71 shares Almost 30 books have followed Miffy's original story in the six decades since her debut.
Interior artworks - in bright hues of green, orange and blue - were commissioned to celebrate the rabbit's 60th 'birthday'
Commuters have been enthralled with the metro walls, which show her dancing around in different coloured pastures
Although there are other themed carriages, the Miffy ones have proven most popular in the campaign
In total, the books have sold over 85 million copies and led to two separate television series as well as a feature-length film released in 2012 entitled 'Miffy the Movie'.
The Guangzhou metro also boasts other carriages specially designed for children, including one very popular Wizard of Oz-themed train.
But the Miffy carriages have definitely stolen the spotlight, taking centre stage in the transport company's themed campaign.
The commuter trains have unsurprisingly become a popular photo spot, making the rest of the country envious
Almost 30 books have followed Miffy's original story in the six decades since her Dutch debut in 1955
Remember the time you could get two Miffys instead of one!?
